content.title: Overview
content.body: You can measure your run in minutes. You can measure your run in meters. You can measure your run in miles. And you can measure your run in seconds. But people rarely measure their runs in seconds. This guided run changes that. Join Coach Bennett on the 1000 Seconds Run. This duration based guided run makes sure you acknowledge and celebrate all those seconds that make up each and every one of your runs. By the end of this inspiring easy run you'll truly believe every second counts... because every second does count.

content.title: Overview
content.body: The name of this run says it all! This quick and fun speed run calls for 12 intervals. Each will be 60 seconds in length. You’ll roll four 60 second intervals at your 5K effort. Then you’ll run four more intervals at your 10K effort for 60 seconds. And then you’ll close out this workout with four 60 seconds intervals at your Mile Pace. Recovery will be 60 seconds long after each interval except for your last 5K and 10K intervals. You will get two minutes recovery after those. This is a fab speed run to work on your efforts and pacing. Believe me... it’s a gas!

content.title: Run Details
content.body:
5:00 Warm Up
1:00 5K Pace (repeat 4 times)
1:00 10K Pace (repeat 4 times)
1:00 Mile Pace (repeat 4 times)

Recovery will be 1:00 after each interval except for final interval at 5K Pace and 10K Pace.

There will be 2:00 recovery after each of those intervals.

32:00 Total Experience

You’re also better. Stronger. Faster. More experienced. Because it doesn’t always need to take a long time to become a better version of yourself. She’s now coaching one of the most successful groups of distance runners in the world with the Bowerman Track Club (BTC).

content.title: Overview
content.body: Speed Play is — you guessed it — all about finding your fast. This is an opportunity to build strength and control by starting with a longer interval, running fast, and then doing it all again. Specifically, you’ll be running 2 long & strong intervals, each followed by 3 quick blasts of speed. Just stay focused, present, & work through the fatigue. Don’t worry, we promise it’ll be worth it.

content.title: Run Details
content.body:
38 minute speed run starts with a 10 minute warm up before pushing the pace with tempo interval efforts. Wraps up with 5 minutes of easy running for the cool down.

Workout includes 2 sets of:

  • 6 min tempo (at 4-5/10 effort) with 2 min recovery
  • 3 x 30 seconds on (at 7/10 effort) with 1 minute recovery

content.title: About Coach Dan
content.body:

content.title: Overview
content.body: Coach Bec is bringing the heat with the third installment of her Spicy Speed series, the final spice! This run uses the traditional Tabata format of the 2:1 work to recovery ratio and delivers a quick, yet highly effective workout. Interval blocks are perfect for any runner looking to take it up a notch. If you’ve already challenged yourself with Spicy Speed I and II, welcome back! If you haven’t, crank up the heat with those first. You’re in for a treat with this 29 minute session of spicy sprints.

content.title: Run Details
content.body:
29 min Tabata run with 5 min jogging warm up and a 5 min cool down.

  • 5 min warm up
  • 3 sets of 8x30 second intervals with 10 seconds of recovery at an all out effort (21 min total work)
  • 5 min cool down

content.title: About Coach Bec
content.body: Knowledge is power. But when you run with Coach Bec, that knowledge turns into extra miles per hour. A native Australian now based in LA, Bec Wilcock is a trainer and endurance athlete who knows that tackling any challenge—whether it’s your first run or your tenth marathon—starts with understanding yourself. With an attention to detail and a sense of adventure, Coach Bec helps you go farther and get there smarter.

content.title: Overview
content.body: Welcome to the Spooky Speed Run! You may be wondering how long the intervals are… or how fast you’ll need to run… you may be wondering how long the recovery will be… but no one knows! Actually, Coach Bennett knows but he’s only going to tell you how fast you need to run and when it’s time to recover and start running again. Everything else… is a mystery! Get ready to work on running in the moment with the Spooky Speed Run!

content.title: Run Details

You’ll be guided through this super fun and surprising (and spooky) speed run without knowing exactly how long each interval is. You will be told the pace and effort but that’s it. How long until the end of each interval? There’s no way to know. (Unless Daniel the Engineer gives hints.)

Coach Manni of Nike Running London will guide you through this fast and fun speed run that has you alternating between your Mile/1500 pace and your Best Pace. Time flies today. And so will you!

content.title: Overview
content.body: This run brings the excitement and passion from trail running to your feet. Coach Bec takes us off the concrete and into the mountains to run wild or at least makes us feel that way.

content.title: Run Details
content.body: 40 minutes of total running broken up by a 5-minute warm up, 30 minutes of varying speeds to simulate trails and a 5-minute cool down.

content.title: About The Coach
content.body: Knowledge is power. But when you run with Coach Bec, that knowledge turns into extra miles per hour. A native Australian now based in LA, Bec Wilcock is a trainer and endurance athlete who knows that tackling any challenge – whether it’s your first run or your tenth marathon – starts with understanding yourself. With an attention to detail and a sense of adventure, Coach Bec helps you go farther, and get there smarter.

content.title: Overview
content.body: It’s important to get good advice when it comes to running. But sometimes bad advice can be helpful too… as long as you know it’s bad advice. Join Nike Running Global Head Coach Chris Bennett for this easy 30-minute run as he shares some of the worst advice he’s ever heard about running and why that terrible advice is just so awful. You’ll learn, laugh and leave the run a better athlete, teammate and coach.

content.title: Run Details
content.body: A relaxed and inspirational 30-minute easy run.

content.title: About Coach
content.body: Chris Bennett is the Nike Running Global Head Coach. Coach Bennett is an NRC pioneer that helped build the Nike Run Club from the ground up. He believes that we all have the ability to become better versions of ourselves.
